    • Method Detail

      • secureDelete

        public java.lang.Boolean secureDelete(java.io.File file)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Delete's file by overwriting with random bytes to the file. Securely removing the specified file from the computer.
        Parameters:
        file - Location of file
        Returns:
        true if the file was successfully and securely removed, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is not found or cannot be overwritten.

      • closeFile

        public java.lang.Boolean closeFile()
        Closes file that is currently open in the bufferedReader and inputStream.
        Returns:
        true - operation is successful. false - otherwise.

      • deleteFile

        public java.lang.Boolean deleteFile()
        Deletes the file in the DEFAULT_FILE_LOCATION.
        Returns:
        true - if the file was deleted successfully. false - otherwise.

      • readFile

        public java.io.BufferedReader readFile()
        Reads file from DEFAULT_FILE_LOCATION.
        Returns:
        BufferedReader - with file contents. NULL otherwise.

      • writeFile

        public boolean writeFile(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String charity,
                java.lang.String amount)
        Writes line to file from the DEFAULT_FILE_LOCATION.
        Parameters:
        name - Specifies name of charity donor
        charity - Specifies name of charity
        amount - Specifies amount of pledge
        Returns:
        true - if line was written to file. false - otherwise.
